intro: Camelina sativa, commonly known as false flax, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other oilseed crops like rapeseed. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with erect stems and lanceolate leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from June to August. Camelina sativa is valued for its oil-rich seeds, which are used in food and industrial applications.
